verses.verse: Then answered <WH6030> Bildad <WH1085> the Shuhite <WH7747>, and said <WH559>,
How <WH575> long <WH5704> will you speak <WH4448> these things <WH561>? and how long shall the words of your mouth <WH6310> be like a strong <WH3524> wind <WH7307>?
Does God <WH410> pervert <WH5791> judgment <WH4941>? or does the Almighty <WH7706> pervert <WH5791> justice <WH6664>?
If your sons <WH1121> have sinned <WH2398> against him <WH7971>, and he have cast them away for <WH3027> their transgression <WH6588>;
If you would seek <WH7836> unto God <WH410> some time <WH7836>, and make your supplication <WH2603> to the Almighty <WH7706>;
If you were pure <WH2134> and upright <WH3477>; surely now he would awake <WH5782> for you <WH5116>, and make the habitation of your righteousness <WH6664> prosperous <WH7999>.
Though your beginning <WH7225> was small <WH4705>, yet your latter end <WH319> should greatly <WH3966> increase <WH7685>.
For inquire <WH7592>, I pray you <WH7223>, of the former age <WH1755>, and prepare <WH3559> yourself to the search <WH2714> of their fathers <WH1>:
(For we are but of yesterday <WH8543>, and know <WH3045> nothing <WH3117>, because our days upon earth <WH776> are a shadow <WH6738>:)
Shall not they teach <WH3384> you <WH559>, and tell you <WH3318>, and utter words <WH4405> out of their heart <WH3820>?
Can the rush <WH1573> grow up <WH1342> without mire <WH1207>? can <WH7685> the flag <WH260> grow <WH7685> without <WH1097> water <WH4325>?
While it is yet in his greenness <WH3>, and not cut down <WH6998>, it withers <WH3001> before <WH6440> any other herb <WH2682>.
So are the paths <WH734> of all that forget <WH7911> God <WH410>; and the hypocrite <WH2611>'s hope <WH8615> shall perish <WH6>:
Whose hope <WH3689> shall be cut off <WH6990>, and whose trust <WH4009> shall be a spider <WH5908>'s web <WH1004>.
He shall lean <WH8172> upon his house <WH1004>, but it shall not stand <WH5975>: he shall hold <WH2388> it fast <WH6965>, but it shall not endure.
He is green <WH7373> before <WH6440> the sun <WH8121>, and his branch <WH3127> shoots forth <WH3318> in his garden <WH1593>.
His roots <WH8328> are wrapped about <WH5440> the heap <WH1530>, and sees <WH2372> the place <WH1004> of stones <WH68>.
If he destroy <WH1104> him from his place <WH4725>, then it shall deny <WH3584> him <WH7200>, saying, I have not seen you.
Behold <WH4885>, this is the joy of his way <WH1870>, and out of the earth <WH6083> shall others <WH312> grow <WH6779>.
Behold <WH410>, God will not cast away <WH3988> a perfect <WH8535> man <WH2388>, neither will he help the evil doers <WH7489>:
Until he fill <WH4390> your mouth <WH6310> with laughing <WH7814>, and your lips <WH8193> with rejoicing <WH8643>.
They that hate <WH8130> you shall be clothed <WH3847> with shame <WH1322>; and the living <WH168> place of the wicked <WH7563> shall come to nothing <WH369>.
